text: Richard Bernard Eheart (professionally known as Red Skelton) (July 18, 1913 â€“ September 17, 1997) was an American entertainer. He was best known for his national radio and television acts between 1937 and 1971 and as host of the television program The Red Skelton Show. Skelton died in Rancho Mirage, California from pneumonia, aged 84. ==References== Category:1913 births Category:1997 deaths Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:American television personalities Category:American radio personalities Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:American voice actors Category:American stage actors Category:American radio actors Category:Actors from Indiana Category:Comedians from Indiana
title: Red Skelton
